member.name: P:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.IIS.WebDirectoryCreate.AuthPersistSingleRequest
member.summary: Setting this flag to true specifies that authentication persists only for a single request on a connection. IIS resets the authentication at the end of each request, and forces re-authentication on the next request of the session.
member.value: Value indicating if AuthPersistSingleRequest is enabled or disabled.

member.name: P:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.IIS.WebDirectoryCreate.AuthPersistSingleRequestIfProxy
member.summary: Setting this flag to true specifies authentication will persist only across single requests on a connection if the connection is by proxy. IIS will reset the authentication at the end of the request if the current authenticated request is by proxy and it is not the special case where IIS is running MSPROXY.
member.value: Value indicating if AuthPersistSingleRequestIfProxy is enabled or disabled.

member.name: P:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.IIS.WebDirectoryCreate.AuthPersistSingleRequestAlwaysIfProxy
member.summary: Setting this flag to true specifies that authentication is valid for a single request if by proxy. IIS will reset the authentication at the end of the request and force re-authentication on the next request if the current authenticated request is by proxy of any type.
member.value: Value indicating if AuthPersistSingleRequestAlwaysIfProxy is enabled or disabled.

member.name: P:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.IIS.WebDirectoryCreate.CacheControlNoCache
member.summary: The CacheControlNoCache property specifies the HTTP 1.1 directive to prevent caching of content.
member.value: Value indicating if CacheControlNoCache is enabled or disabled.

member.name: P:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.IIS.WebDirectoryCreate.CacheIsapi

member.value: Value indicating if CacheIsapi is enabled or disabled.

member.name: P:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.IIS.WebDirectoryCreate.CpuAppEnabled

member.name: P:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.IIS.WebDirectoryCreate.DefaultDoc
member.summary: The DefaultDoc contains one or more file names of default documents that will be returned to the client if no file name is included in the client's request. The default document will be returned if the flag of the DirBrowseFlags property is set to true for the directory. This property can contain a list of default document file names separated by a comma and a space, for example Default.htm, Default.asp.
member.value: Listing of the default documents for the web application.

member.name: T:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.IIS.AppPoolDelete
member.summary: Deletes an existing application pool on a local or remote machine with IIS installed. The default is to delete an existing application pool on the local machine. If connecting to a remote machine, you can specify the and for the task to run under.
member.example:

<AppPoolDelete AppPoolName="MyAppPool" />

member.name: T:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.IIS.WebDirectoryDelete

member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, executes the task.

member.name: T:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Math.Divide
member.summary: Divide numbers
member.example:
<Math.Divide Numbers="1;2"> <Output TaskParameter="Result" PropertyName="Result" /> </Math.Divide> <Message Text="Divide 1/2= $(Result)"/>
Above example will display: Divide 1/2= 0.5

Truncate the result to always return an integer:
<Math.Divide Numbers="7;3" TruncateResult="true"> <Output TaskParameter="Result" PropertyName="Result" /> </Math.Divide> <Message Text="Divide 7/3= $(Result)"/>
Above example will display: Divide 7/3= 2

member.name: M:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Math.Divide.Execute
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, executes the task.
member.returns: true if the task successfully executed; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Math.Divide.TruncateResult
member.summary: When , uses integer division to truncate the result. Default is
member.remarks:
Any remainder in the result is dropped, and the closest integer to zero is returned.
Refer to the documentation for the \ Operator for more information about integer division.

member.name: T:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.RegistryRead
member.summary: Reads a value from the Registry
member.example:
Read .NET Framework install root from Registry.
<RegistryRead KeyName="HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\.NETFramework" ValueName="InstallRoot"> <Output TaskParameter="Value" PropertyName="InstallRoot" /> </RegistryRead> <Message Text="InstallRoot: $(InstallRoot)"/>
member.remarks:
The parameter is set according to the following rules:
If a is provided, it will be used if the or does not exist.
If a is not provided, the exists, but the does not exist, will be set to an empty string.
If a is not provided, and the does not exist, the task will fail.

member.name: T:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Script
member.summary: Executes code contained within the task.

example.para: Simple script that writes to the console
example.code:
<PropertyGroup>
    <HelloCode>
        <![CDATA[
        public static void ScriptMain() {
            Console.WriteLine("Hello MSBuild Community Scripting World.");
        }
        ]] >
    </HelloCode>
</PropertyGroup>
<Target Name="Hello">
    <Script Language="C#" Code="$(HelloCode)" Imports="System" />
</Target>

<PropertyGroup> <GetProgramFilesCode> <![CDATA[ public static string ScriptMain() { return Environment.GetFolderPath(Environment.SpecialFolder.ProgramFiles); } ]] > </GetProgramFilesCode> </PropertyGroup> <Target Name="GetProgramFilesFolder"> <Script Language="C#" Code="$(GetProgramFilesCode)"> <Output TaskParameter="ReturnValue" PropertyName="ProgramFilesFolder" /> </Script> <Message Text="Program files are in: $(ProgramFilesFolder)" /> </Target>

member.name: M:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Script.Execute
member.summary: Executes the task.
member.returns: if the task ran successfully; otherwise .

member.name: P:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Script.References
member.summary: The required references

member.name: P:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Script.Imports
member.summary: The namespaces to import.

member.name: P:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Script.Language
member.summary: The language of the script block (defaults to C#).
member.remarks:
The supported languages are:
Visual Basic.NET (VB, vb, VISUALBASIC)
C# (C#, c#, CSHARP)
JavaScript (JS, js, JSCRIPT)
J# (VJS, vjs, JSHARP) or, proviude the fully-qualified name for a class implementing .

member.name: P:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Script.MainClass
member.summary: The name of the main class containing the static ScriptMain entry point.

member.name: P:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Script.Code
member.summary: The code to compile and execute
member.remarks: The code must include a static (Shared in VB) method named ScriptMain. It cannot accept any parameters. If you define the method return a , the returned value will be available in the output property.

member.summary: The string returned from the custom ScriptMain method.

member.name: T:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.SqlExecute
member.summary: Executes a SQL command.
member.remarks:
Execute a SQL command against a database. Target attributes to set: ConnectionString (required), Command (required, the SQL to execute), SelectMode (NonQuery, Scalar, or ScalarXml, default is NonQuery), OutputFile (required when SelectMode is Scalar or ScalarXml).
Note: ScalarXml was created because of the 2033 byte limit on the sql return. See http://aspnetresources.com/blog/executescalar_truncates_xml.aspx for details.
member.example:
Example of returning a count of items in a table. Uses the default SelectMode of NonQuery.
<SqlExecute ConnectionString="server=MyServer;Database=MyDatabase;Trusted_Connection=yes;" Command="create database MyDatabase" />
Example of returning the items of a table in an xml format.
<SqlExecute ConnectionString="server=MyServer;Database=MyDatabase;Trusted_Connection=yes;" Command="select * from SomeTable for xml auto" SelectMode="ScalarXml" OutputFile="SomeTable.xml" />

member.name: M:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.SqlExecute.Execute
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, executes the task.
member.returns: true if the task successfully executed; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Determines if an output file was specified.

member.summary: The command to execute

member.summary: Command Timeout
member.remarks: Defaults to 30 seconds. Set to 0 for an infinite timeout period.

member.name: P:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.SqlExecute.SelectMode
member.summary: The SQL Selection Mode. Set to NonQuery, Scalar, or ScalarXml. Default is NonQuery.

member.name: T:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Version
member.summary: Generates version information based on various algorithms
member.example:
Get version information from file and increment revision.
<Version VersionFile="number.txt" BuildType="Automatic" RevisionType="Increment"> <Output TaskParameter="Major" PropertyName="Major" /> <Output TaskParameter="Minor" PropertyName="Minor" /> <Output TaskParameter="Build" PropertyName="Build" /> <Output TaskParameter="Revision" PropertyName="Revision" /> </Version> <Message Text="Version: $(Major).$(Minor).$(Build).$(Revision)"/>

Specify Major and Minor version information and generate Build and Revision.
<Version BuildType="Automatic" RevisionType="Automatic" Major="1" Minor="3" > <Output TaskParameter="Major" PropertyName="Major" /> <Output TaskParameter="Minor" PropertyName="Minor" /> <Output TaskParameter="Build" PropertyName="Build" /> <Output TaskParameter="Revision" PropertyName="Revision" /> </Version> <Message Text="Version: $(Major).$(Minor).$(Build).$(Revision)"/>

member.name: M:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Version.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Version.Execute
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, executes the task.
member.returns: true if the task successfully executed; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Version.Major
member.summary: Gets or sets the major version number.

member.name: P:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Version.Minor
member.summary: Gets or sets the minor version number.

member.name: P:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Version.Build
member.summary: Gets or sets the build version number.

member.name: P:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Version.Revision
member.summary: Gets or sets the revision version number.

member.name: P:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Version.VersionFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the file used to initialize and persist the version.
member.remarks:
When specified, the task will attempt to load the previous version information from the file. After updating the version, the new value will be saved to the file.
If you do not specify a value for this property, the version will be calculated based on the values passed to the , , , and properties. The new version will not be persisted.

member.name: P:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Version.MajorType
member.summary: Gets or sets the method used to generate a number
member.remarks:
If value is not provided, None is assumed. The number is set according to the following table:
MajorTypeDescription
NoneThe number is not modified.
IncrementIncreases the previous value by 1.

member.name: P:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Version.MinorType
member.summary: Gets or sets the method used to generate a number
member.remarks:
If value is not provided, None is assumed. The number is set according to the following table:
MinorTypeDescription
NoneThe number is not modified.
IncrementIncreases the previous value by 1.
ResetResets the previous value to 0.

member.name: P:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Version.BuildType
member.summary: Gets or sets the method used to generate a number
member.remarks:
If value is not provided, None is assumed. The number is set according to the following table:
BuildTypeDescription
NoneThe number is not modified.
AutomaticThe number of days since .
IncrementIncreases the previous value by 1.
ResetResets the previous value to 0.

member.name: P:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Version.RevisionType
member.summary: Gets or sets the method used to generate a number
member.remarks:
If value is not provided, None is assumed. The number is set according to the following table:
RevisionTypeDescription
NoneThe number is not modified.
AutomaticA number that starts at 0 at midnight, and constantly increases throughout the day (changing roughly every 1.3 seconds). Guaranteed to be safe for components of the AssemblyVersion attribute.
IncrementIncreases the previous value by 1.
BuildIncrementIncreases the previous value by 1 when the value of is unchanged. If the value of has changed, is reset to 0.
ResetResets the previous value to 0.

member.name: P:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Version.StartDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the starting date used to calculate the number when is Automatic.
member.value: The starting date for calculation of the build number.
member.remarks:
This value is only used when the is Automatic.
This default value is January 1, 2000.

member.name: T:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.WebDownload
member.summary: Downloads a resource with the specified URI to a local file.
member.example:
Download the Microsoft.com home page.
<WebDownload FileUri="http://www.microsoft.com/default.aspx" FileName="microsoft.html" />

Download a page from your local intranet protected by Windows Authentication
<WebDownload FileUri="http://intranet/default.aspx" FileName="page.html" UseDefaultCredentials="True" />

Download a page from a password protected website
<WebDownload FileUri="http://example.com/myscore.aspx" FileName="page.html" Username="joeuser" Password="password123" />

member.name: T:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.XmlRead
member.summary: Reads a value from a XML document using a XPath.
member.example:
Read all targest from a build project.
<XmlRead Prefix="n" Namespace="http://schemas.microsoft.com/developer/msbuild/2003" XPath="/n:Project/n:Target/@Name" XmlFileName="Subversion.proj"> <Output TaskParameter="Value" PropertyName="BuildTargets" /> </XmlRead> <Message Text="Build Targets: $(BuildTargets)"/>
member.remarks: If the XPath returns multiple nodes, the Value will be a semicolon delimited list of the nodes text.

member.name: T:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.XmlUpdate
member.summary: Updates a XML document using a XPath.
member.example:
Update a XML element.
<XmlUpdate Prefix="n" Namespace="http://schemas.microsoft.com/developer/msbuild/2003" XPath="/n:Project/n:PropertyGroup/n:TestUpdate" XmlFileName="Subversion.proj" Value="Test from $(MSBuildProjectFile)"/>
member.remarks: The XML node being updated must exist before using the XmlUpdate task.

member.name: T:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Zip
member.summary: Create a zip file with the files specified.
member.example:
Create a zip file
<ItemGroup> <ZipFiles Include="**\*.*" Exclude="*.zip" /> </ItemGroup> <Target Name="Zip"> <Zip Files="@(ZipFiles)" ZipFileName="MSBuild.Community.Tasks.zip" /> </Target>
Create a zip file using a working directory.
<ItemGroup> <RepoFiles Include="D:\svn\repo\**\*.*" /> </ItemGroup> <Target Name="Zip"> <Zip Files="@(RepoFiles)" WorkingDirectory="D:\svn\repo" ZipFileName="D:\svn\repo.zip" /> </Target>

member.name: M:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Zip.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Zip.ZipLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the zip level. Default is 6.
member.remarks: 0 - store only to 9 - means best compression

member.name: P:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Zip.Flatten
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this is flatten.
member.remarks: Flattening the zip means that all directories will be removed and the files will be place at the root of the zip file

member.name: P:MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Zip.WorkingDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets the working directory for the zip file.
member.remarks: The working directory is the base of the zip file. All files will be made relative from the working directory.
